metadata.title: CVE-2022-48670 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: peci:cpu: Fix use-after-free in adev_release() When auxiliary_device_add()returns an error, auxiliary_device_uninit() is called, which causesrefcount for device to be decremented and .release callback will betriggered. Because adev_release() re-calls auxiliary_device_uninit(), itwill cause use-after-free: [ 1269.455172] WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 14267 atlib/refcount.c:28 refcount_warn_saturate+0x110/0x15 [ 1269.464007]refcount_t: underflow; use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
